content.raw:
Beside my inline comment, this indeed fix [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/44/time-sleep-always-returns-time-0-0-even-if](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/44/time-sleep-always-returns-time-0-0-even-if) . 

However, I wonder the behaviour actually reflects the documentation, i.e. that it returns the “[Time](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/common/0.4/classignition_1_1common_1_1Time.html) actually slept ". As it is now, if a system is under and heavy load, the time actually spent between the call to the `Sleep` method and the return of the method can be be longer than the time requested \(depending on when the scheduler schedules  
the thread\).  If a method returns the “Time actually slept”, an user could be thinking that it would also report the additional time spent before the end of the sleep period and the scheduling time. A possible solution is just to clarify the documentaton, and that could be part of a different PR.
